STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 18, 2025
Matthew Yohe
BARAGA/HOUGHTON/KEWEENAW COUNTY DHHS
108 MAIN ST,
BARAGA, MI, 49908-9671
Re: License #: CP070200958
Dear Mr. Yohe:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
08/13/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
• (3) An agency shall provide the licensee an
application for renewal of the license and
document the action not less than 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. A
renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending
recommendation for disciplinary action of the
license.
Two of three foster home files reviewed documented the renewal application was
submitted to the foster parent less than 60 days from the renewal date.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the
evaluation, an agency shall complete a written
report that includes all the following information:
• (e) Conclusions regarding licensing rules
compliance or noncompliance based on the
findings of fact.
One of three foster hone files reviewed contained a special evaluation where there
was no rule violation and this was inconsistent with the facts in the evaluation.
2

The special evaluation was also incomplete as it did not describe how a child was
removed from a room on several occasions.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of three foster care files reviewed contained an updated service plan that was
completed late.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Three of three foster care files reviewed contained one or more PATP's where
signatures were missing or late.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• The agency was informed DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS Policy.
DCWL Consultants will only be auditing rules described in the "Licensing Rules
For Child Placing Agencies" rule book.
• ·The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting
the foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and other
3

relevant parties and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan would meet
the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.
• The agency was informed that an addendum to special evaluation
#2025SEC0000170 should be completed addressing the concern of how the
foster mother removed the child from a room several times. The evaluation also
did not require a CAP and this was incongruent with the facts of the investigation.
Documentation of the addendum should be forwarded to the DCWL Consultant
upon completion.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 07/11/2024 in response
to two violations established during the 06/05/2024 renewal inspection. During the
inspection the agency was cited for policy FOM 722-06H Case Contacts, and
FOM 801-03 Medical Passports. There were no repeat violations established
during this current Interim Inspection indicating the agency CAP was successful in
preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators assessment was reviewed. The assessment
documented review of the rule violations established during the renewal inspection
and agency efforts to obtain compliance. Barriers were discussed, namely staff
turnover including the program supervisor and a foster care worker. These
positions have since been filled and there are still two vacancies to fill. Other
barriers include bio-parents missing parenting time visits and parents refusing to
meet with the agency for treatment plan development.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
4

Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their supervisor however the
agency has been running short staffed due to staff turnover and this creates
additional stress in trying to keep up with workloads. Staff reported they are
hopeful additional hiring will alleviate the workload and job stress.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern DHHS building in Baraga. There is sufficient
office space for staff and a lobby that is staffed to serve the public. CHRI
documents were observed to be secured.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst established one safety alert during visits to the homes. The safety
alert is as follows:
Safety Alert #!. A safety alert was generated on 06/10/2025 as the home did not have a
smoke alarm outside of the child's bedroom.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 06/12/2025 as a smoke alarm was installed
and a photo provided of the installed alarm.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
August 15, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 18, 2025
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
